inventory.commentary: 24Oct08 added senses 6,7 and 8; added features. ahouston

sense.name: down feather
sense.examples: This comforter is made of down.

sense.name: soft hair
sense.commentary: DOWN[+body_part][+undercoat][+hair][+of_mammal] fine soft dense hair (as the fine short hair of cattle or deer or the wool of sheep or the undercoat of certain dogs.
sense.examples: Our St. Bernard's down keeps her warm in the cold.

sense.name: american football: downs
sense.commentary: DOWN[+event][+play][+football][+for_advancement][+of_ball] a complete play to advance the football
sense.examples: You have four downs to gain ten yards.

sense.name: highland
sense.commentary: DOWN[+location][+geographical][+highland][+rolling] a rolling treeless highland with little soil (usually plural)
sense.examples: The downs in the northern part of the state are beautiful.

sense.name: Mr. Down
sense.commentary: Down, John L. H. Down - English physician who first described Down's syndrome (1828 - 1896

sense.name: an unpleasant or difficult experience
sense.examples: Their marriage has had its ups and downs over the years. The economy experienced more ups than downs during the past decade.

sense.name: personal emotional depression
sense.examples: The patient has experienced severe downs without his medication. John's down after his divorce lasted more than a year.

sense.name: a direction opposite of up
sense.examples: When she experienced vertigo she could not tell down from up. Down and up are completely relative directions in space.
